result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Guy O'Dierno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. Must complete Domestic Violence Intervention Program  Mental Health Treatment

records.addlTxt: 8:36AM Defendant Matthew G O'Dierno in court.  Attorney Faun Michelle Moses in court for Matthew G O'Dierno.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Anthony Urbik in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to counts three and four. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Court orders sentence withheld, four years probation with conditions, Must complete Domestic Violence Intervention Program, Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, Mental Health Treatment, No contact with K.O. Court costs due December 2 2022 Remaining Counts are dismissed and read in. 16 Days Credit. Felony rights given to defendant.

Activity: Bail/bond hearing

10:33 AM Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Guy O'Dierno appeared by video.  Attorney Faun Michelle Moses appeared by video for Matthew Guy O'Dierno. Kim Rau appeared by video for victim witness office. Victim KO appeared by video. Parties argue bond conditions. Court modifies bond condition only to Bond conditions amended, No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.O., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except may answer text messages received from K.O and may respond to those texts. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. GPS Monitor instead of scram bracelet is ordered not to be within 500 feet of residence and monitored through JusticePoint. Remand to branch 6 for scheduling.

Absolute Sobriety. Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint. Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Not to posses alcohol, not to be in any place that serves alcohol.   No contact directly or indirectly with victim KO, his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. May receive text from K.O. and respond to those texts. GPS monitor ordered in place of Scram bracelet, may not be within 500 feet of residence and monitored by JusticePoint.
